name: Advanced Social Engineering Reversal
description: Tactics to subvert and counter PSN attempts at deception, coercion, or manipulation in social settings.

cards.title: Reframing the Hook
cards.description: Turning their manipulation strategy into a self-sabotaging trap.
bulletpoints: Redirecting leading questions back to force self-incrimination.
Reversing attempted emotional appeals into logical voids.
Using confusion loops to disorient and disengage their tactics.
cards.summaryText: Bounce every leading question back at them, strip their emotional plays down to cold logic, and spin confusion loops until they walk into their own trap.

cards.title: Flipping Social Proof Pressure
cards.description: Using the group dynamic against the manipulator in real time.
bulletpoints: Amplifying group awareness of PSN tactics without directly accusing.
Reframing their control attempts as ‘overreactions’ or ‘odd behavior’.
Leveraging humor to subtly dismantle their credibility.
cards.summaryText: Cue the room into their tactics without pointing fingers, paint their behavior as over-the-top, and puncture their authority with a well-timed joke.

cards.title: Linguistic Ambiguity Attacks
cards.description: Using vague and ambiguous language to undermine manipulative precision.
bulletpoints: Responding with layered meanings to force them into guesswork.
Asking clarifying questions to break conversational momentum.
Deliberately misinterpreting their words to dissolve persuasive impact.
cards.summaryText: Answer with double meanings that make them guess, slow things down with constant clarifiers, and purposely misread their words so their script falls apart.
